subject: Art & Design
title: Font vs. Typeface: The Real Difference
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Font vs. Typeface: The Real Difference.

hook.text: Helvetica is a typeface. Helvetica Bold 12pt is a font. Most people say 'font' for both.

buildup.text: A typeface is the design family. A font is a specific weight, size, and style within that family.

discovery.text: Think of it like music: the typeface is the song, the font is a specific recording of it.

twist.text: In the digital era, the distinction barely matters in conversation. But knowing it shows craft.

climax.text: When you pick 'Roboto Regular 16px' in CSS, you're selecting a font from the Roboto typeface.

punchline.text: Typeface is the design. Font is the file. Now you know.

quiz.question: What is the difference between a typeface and a font?
options: A typeface is the design family; a font is a specific weight/size within it
They are exactly the same thing
Typefaces are for print; fonts are for screens
